TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HtmlTableRow extends System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl

Docs.summary: Represents the HTML element in an control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `<tr>` element represents a row in a table. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class to programmatically control the `<tr>` HTML elements in an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class allows you to customize the appearance of a row in a table by specifying the background color, the border color, and the height of the cells in the row. These attributes are set using the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.BgColor%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.BorderColor%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Height%2A> properties.
You can control the alignment of the contents in the cells for the entire row by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Align%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.VAlign%2A> properties. The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Align%2A> property controls the horizontal alignment of the contents of the cells, while the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.VAlign%2A> property controls the vertical alignment.
By using the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Cells%2A> collection of this class, you can programmatically access the individual cells in a row of a table. This allows you to control the properties of each cell, as well as the content.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> instance to represent a row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control. An <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> is retrieved from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable.Rows%2A> collection of the table and its contents are modified.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HtmlTableRow#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRow/CS/htmltablerowcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HtmlTableRow#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRow/VB/htmltablerowvb.aspx#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class. This constructor is used to create an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> object that represents the `<tr>` element for a table row.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow>.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.TagName%2A>|The "tr" literal string.|
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create an instance of an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control with <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> controls and place the table on the Web page.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HtmlTableCtor#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableCtor/CS/htmltablectorcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HtmlTableCtor#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableCtor/VB/htmltablectorvb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Align { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Align : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the content in the cells of a row in an control.
Docs.value: The horizontal alignment of the content in the cells of a row in an control. The default value is , which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Align%2A> property to specify the horizontal alignment of the content in the cells of a row in an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control.
> [!NOTE] > Setting this property affects all cells in a row of a table represented by an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class. To apply an alignment attribute to a single cell of a row, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableCell.Align%2A> property for that cell.
The following table lists the values that can be used for this property.
|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |`Left`|Aligns the contents of the cell with the left edge of the cell.| |`Center`|Aligns the contents of the cell in the middle of the cell.| |`Right`|Aligns the contents of the cell with the right edge of the cell.|
> [!NOTE] > You can also use `Justify` and `Char` as values for this property. However, not all browsers support these features.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Align%2A> property to control the horizontal alignment of the contents of the cells in an entire row.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HtmlTableRowBehavior#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowBehavior/CS/htmltablerowbehaviorcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HtmlTableRowBehavior#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowBehavior/VB/htmltablerowbehaviorvb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ BgColor { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.BgColor : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the row represented by an instance of the class.
Docs.value: The background color of the row represented by an instance of .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.BgColor%2A> property to specify the background color of the row represented by an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class. You can specify a color either by name or by using a hexadecimal value, preceded by the pound character (#), in the form #RRGGBB. RR, GG, and BB represent hexadecimal values from 0 to 255 that indicate the red, green, and blue components of a color, respectively. For example, the value #0000FF represents the color blue. It specifies the minimum value (00) for the red and green components, while specifying the maximum value (FF) for the blue component.
The following table shows the sixteen predefined HTML color names and corresponding hexadecimal values that can be used for the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.BgColor%2A> property. For more information on HTML colors, see the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).
|Color name|Hexadecimal value| |----------------|-----------------------| |Aqua|#00FFFF| |Black|#000000| |Blue|#0000FF| |Fuchsia|#FF00FF| |Gray|#808080| |Green|#008000| |Lime|#00FF00| |Maroon|#800000| |Navy|#000080| |Olive|#808000| |Purple|#800080| |Red|#FF0000| |Silver|#C0C0C0| |Teal|#008080| |White|#FFFFFF| |Yellow|#FFFF00|
The available colors for use with the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.BgColor%2A> property can be determined from the <xref:System.Drawing.KnownColor> enumeration.
Color names are case-insensitive.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.BgColor%2A> property to control the background color of a row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HtmlTableRowAppearance#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowAppearance/CS/htmltablerowappearancecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HtmlTableRowAppearance#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowAppearance/VB/htmltablerowappearancevb.aspx#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableCell.BorderColor%2A> property to specify the border color of the row represented by an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class. You can specify a color either by name or by using a hexadecimal value, preceded by the pound character (#), in the form #RRGGBB. RR, GG, and BB represent hexadecimal values from 0 to 255 that indicate the red, green, and blue components of a color, respectively. For example, the value #0000FF represents the color blue. It specifies the minimum value (00) for the red and green components, while specifying the maximum value (FF) for the blue component.
The following table shows the sixteen predefined HTML color names and corresponding hexadecimal values that can be used for the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.BorderColor%2A> property. For more information on HTML colors, see the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).
|Color name|Hexadecimal value| |----------------|-----------------------| |Aqua|#00FFFF| |Black|#000000| |Blue|#0000FF| |Fuchsia|#FF00FF| |Gray|#808080| |Green|#008000| |Lime|#00FF00| |Maroon|#800000| |Navy|#000080| |Olive|#808000| |Purple|#800080| |Red|#FF0000| |Silver|#C0C0C0| |Teal|#008080| |White|#FFFFFF| |Yellow|#FFFF00|
The available colors for use with the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.BorderColor%2A> property can be determined from the <xref:System.Drawing.KnownColor> enumeration.
Color names are case-insensitive.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.BorderColor%2A> property to control the border color of a row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HtmlTableRowAppearance#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowAppearance/CS/htmltablerowappearancecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HtmlTableRowAppearance#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowAppearance/VB/htmltablerowappearancevb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property Cells As HtmlTableCellCollection

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of objects that represent the cells contained in a row of the control.
Docs.value: An that contains the cells of a row in an control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Cells%2A> collection to programmatically access the cells of a row in an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control. You can programmatically add, remove, and insert cells in the collection.
> [!NOTE] > If there are no cells defined in a row, an empty <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableCellCollection> object is returned.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Cells%2A> collection to iterate through the cells of a row, represented by an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> object. The cells are then updated with new content.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HtmlTableRow#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRow/CS/htmltablerowcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HtmlTableRow#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRow/VB/htmltablerowvb.aspx#1)]

Docs.summary: Creates a new object for the control.
Docs.returns: A that contains the control's child server controls.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.CreateControlCollection%2A> method creates a new <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection> collection that is used to hold the row cells.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.CreateControlCollection%2A> method is primarily of interest to control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> control.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Height { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Height : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the height (in pixels) of the row represented by an instance of the class.
Docs.value: The height (in pixels) of the row represented by an instance of . The default value is , which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Height%2A> property to specify the height (in pixels) of the cell represented by an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class. All cells in the row share the same height.
> [!NOTE] > If you specify a height that is smaller than is required to display the contents of the cells in the row of a table, this property is ignored.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Height%2A> property to control the height of a row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HtmlTableRowAppearance#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowAppearance/CS/htmltablerowappearancecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HtmlTableRowAppearance#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowAppearance/VB/htmltablerowappearancevb.aspx#1)]

This property is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl> class and is not applicable to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class.

MemberSignature.Value: protected internal override void RenderChildren (System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance void RenderChildren(class System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer) cil managed
Protected Friend Overrides Sub RenderChildren (writer As HtmlTextWriter)

Docs.param: The object that receives the rendered content.
Docs.summary: Renders the control's child controls to the specified object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.RenderChildren%2A> method provides additional formatting before and after calling the base class's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.RenderChildren%2A> method. The additional formatting makes the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> control's rendered HTML easier to read by adding a line return and indenting before rendering the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> control's child objects.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.RenderChildren%2A> method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void RenderEndTag(class System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub RenderEndTag (writer As HtmlTextWriter)

Docs.param: The object that receives the rendered content.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.RenderEndTag%2A> method provides additional formatting after calling the base class's <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl.RenderEndTag%2A> method. The added formatting makes the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> control's rendered HTML easier to read by adding a line return after the closing `<tr>` tag.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.RenderEndTag%2A> method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> control.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ VAlign { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.VAlign : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of the content in the cells of a row in an control.
Docs.value: The vertical alignment of the content in the cells of a row in an control. The default value is , which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.VAlign%2A> property to specify the vertical alignment of the content in the cells of a row in an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control.
> [!NOTE] > Setting this property affects all cells in a row of a table represented by an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class. To apply an alignment attribute to a single cell of a row, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableCell.VAlign%2A> property for that cell.
The following table lists the values that can be used for this property.
|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |`Top`|Aligns the contents of a cell with the upper edge of the cell.| |`Middle`|Aligns the contents of a cell in the center of the cell.| |`Bottom`|Aligns the contents of a cell with the lower edge of the cell.|
> [!NOTE] > You can also use `BaseLine` as a value for this property. However, not all browsers support this feature.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.VAlign%2A> property to control the vertical alignment of the contents of the cells in an entire row.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HtmlTableRowBehavior#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowBehavior/CS/htmltablerowbehaviorcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HtmlTableRowBehavior#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowBehavior/VB/htmltablerowbehaviorvb.aspx#1)]
